players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
Bob was found dead.
You investigated Charlie and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.
You: "Charlie is the mafioso. We need to vote him out today before he kills again."
Diana: "Alice, accusing Charlie so quickly feels risky. We should hear from Charlie before voting to avoid making a mistake."
Charlie: "Accusing me without proof only divides the town. Let's focus on gathering facts instead of jumping to conclusions."
You: "Alice here again: I understand Diana's caution, but I already have proof from last night’s investigation—Charlie is mafia. We must act fast or risk losing another town member."
Diana: "Alice, if you really have proof, please share what you found last night so we can all be sure. We can’t afford to accidentally vote out an innocent."
Charlie: "I find it suspicious that Alice claims to have proof but hasn't shared any details yet. If she truly investigated, why not reveal her findings now to help us all decide?"
